content: प्रवृत् {c1c} <ab>A.</ab> {@--1@} To go, forward, move on, proceed; स्वामिसेवकयोरेवं वृत्तिचक्रं प्रवर्तते <ls>Pt. 1. 81.</ls> {@--2@} To arise, be produced, spring; <ls>Pt. 1. 6.</ls> {@--3@} To happen, come to pass, take place. {@--4@} To begin, commence (usually with <ab>inf.</ab>); हंत प्रवृत्तं संगीतकं <ls>M. 1</ls>; <ls>Ku. 3. 25.</ls> {@--5@} To strive, exert oneself; प्रवर्ततां प्रकृतिहिताय पार्थिवः <ls>Ś. 7. 35.</ls> {@--6@} To act up to, follow; <ls>Pt. 1. 116.</ls> {@--7@} To engage in, be occupied with; <ls>Ku. 5. 33.</ls> {@--8@} To act, do; न पुनरेवं प्रवर्तितव्यं <ls>Ś. 6.</ls> {@--9@} To act or behave towards. {@--10@} To prevail, exist; राजन् प्रजासु ते कश्चिदपचारः प्रवर्तते <ls>R. 15. 47.</ls> {@--11@} To hold good. {@--12@} To proceed uninterruptedly, thrive; <ls>Bg. 17. 24</ls>; <ls>Ms. 3. 61.</ls> {%--<ab>Caus.</ab>%} {@--1@} To proceed with, continue; <ls>Mu. 2.</ls> {@--2@} To introduce. {@--3@} To set on foot, establish, found. {@--4@} To drive, propel, urge, stimulate. {@--5@} To promote, advance. {@--6@} To throw, cast. {@--7@} To produce, create. {@--8@} To invent, devise.
